Collection.name: Records
Collection.type: Eamon.ThirdParty.BTree`1[[Eamon.Framework.IArtifact, Eamon, Version=1.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]], Eamon, Version=1.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: broken door

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It is an average insulated door except that it is splintered and broken where the hinges once were. Through it all, a small sign has remained nailed to it.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: A sign has been hastily attached to the broken door with rusty nails. The message on it is faded but you could still READ it.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The mailbox is a small, black aluminum receptacle mounted to the side of the building. It has almost rusted shut from lack of use, but will still OPEN.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: piece of paper

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a piece of paper that has been folded neatly in half. You unfold it and see that it has some writing on it.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The door is made of a solid oak and reinforced by steel bands. It has a brass knob with a small keyhole under it.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: brass key

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a small old fashioned key made of brass. It has a little smiley face tag attached to it which reads, "Office".

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The toilet is a dirty white color and the porcelain is a bit chipped. It appears to be functional and you notice nothing special or unusual about it.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The sink is made of stainless steel and has a cabinet below it.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a cabinet which has been crudely constructed from old crooked boards. It looks as though it hasn't been opened in ages.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a rusty pipe wrench which could also be used as a weapon. Eamon Deluxe monsters are "smart", GIVE WRENCH TO EDDIE, then REQUEST his mace and he will READY the wrench (or a better weapon) if he is carrying one.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: kitchen knife

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a kitchen knife that someone has left sitting out. It has a long, although rather dull, blade and would not make a very good weapon until sharpened.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Someone has left a fresh ham and cheese sitting here. It has one large bite taken out of it and looks like it was just made.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see an expensive, well-crafted oak desk in the center of the room. It has a single drawer (OPEN DESK) and an old typewriter sits on top of it. You are suddenly alarmed by what appears to be freshly spattered blood on one corner of it.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a very old Smith-Corona, possibly an antique. Sam Slicker would probably pay a decent price for this relic.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The shelves have dust marks which give the impression that not so long ago they were filled with books. Only one book remains now. Odd, that book appears to be connected to the back of the shelves. (EXAMINE BOOK)

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: pile of ashes

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The pile of ashes is still warm and appears to have been made from a large amount of paper. Unfortunately, everything has been burnt beyond recognition.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: book (a secret door north)

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: By pulling on the book, you cause the set of shelves on the north wall to swing open, revealing a secret door!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The only thing inside the desk is a small diary. It is leather bound and full of writing.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: giant club

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The ogre's weapon is a giant hunk of wood with nails in the end.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: secret door in the south wall

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You press a loose brick and the south wall swings open, revealing a hidden passage.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a tarnished old lantern. The glass is cracked and it has a few dents in it but it still looks like it will light.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a very poor quality spear. The shaft is made from a crooked stick and the tip is loosely fashioned at the end of it. It would make a terrible weapon.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: One of the Ogres dropped a large axe. For its size, it seems extremely light and the blade is razor sharp. A faint green glow seems to indicate that it is a magic weapon!

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: broken sword

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The sword was a poor Marcos style generic model. It is now covered with fresh blood and the blade has been broken off at the hilt.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: One of the giants dropped a wicked looking spear. Its razor sharp tip gleams menacingly.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: battle axe

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see an axe that one of the giants dropped. It is a plain, standard Marcos type with a chipped blade.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: pointed stick

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: One of the giants dropped a long stick with a sharp point carved into the end.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Black Bob was using a sling shot as a weapon. It is well crafted and has a good supply of stones to go with it.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see Nice Guy Eddie's weapon, a wicked spiked club. The spikes are well sharpened and the weapon is very well balanced.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: goose shield

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Nice Guy Eddie was carrying a sturdy shield with a large goose painted on the front of it.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: secret message

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Nice Guy Eddie was carrying a folded piece of paper with your name on it!

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: hunting knife

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a sharp knife with a 12-inch blade that belonged to Newt Traal.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: long sword

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see Andy's weapon, an average Marcos style long sword.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: cell door

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The cell door is made out of roughly forged metals but looks pretty sturdy.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: skeleton key

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The guard was carrying a small skeleton key which obviously opens the cell.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The rack is a horrible torture device used to stretch victims far beyond their limits.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: pile of straw

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see nothing special about the pile of straw except for maybe the rare species of flea which inhabit it.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a poor man with cuts and bruises all over his body. He is shackled to the wall and pleads with you to release him.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The Interrogator has dropped a small black whip. It looks like it would make a poor quality weapon.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: bamboo shoot

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see an array of bamboo shoots for putting under people's fingernails.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The prisoner seems to have been carrying a card with your name on it.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: sea shell

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a large assortment of pretty shells of all different colors. You could probably sell them to craft workers back at the Main Hall for a decent amount.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: wooden trunk

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a large wooden trunk with leather and steel bands keeping it closed and secure.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: old chest

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see an old chest with leather and steel bands keeping it closed and secure.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You find a solid gold "decoder" ring which must have come from some young prince's breakfast cereal. This is an example of clothing type #5 (jewelry) and, of course, you can WEAR it.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: wooden door

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: A plain wooden door blocks your passage to the south. It has no keyhole but it doesn't look very sturdy and could easily be forced open. (Note: Just as you can ATTACK doors and containers, you can also BLAST them as well.)

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: healing potion

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a white bottle with a black label that reads, "HEALING POTION".

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a message tacked over the sink. It says, "Try to READ me, I have been put here to deliberately generate a game error."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a second message, also tacked over the sink. It says, "Try to READ me too, as I have also been put here to deliberately generate a game error."

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: dead rat

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a dead rat that was floating in the toilet. This is an example of (yech!!) a dead body that can be picked up.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: dead wumpus

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a poor dead wumpus all shriveled up in the corner. This is an example of a normal dead body artifact. It can't be picked up and will be totally ignored by GET ALL, but note that you can ATTACK bodies.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: rubber chicken

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a rubber chicken, commonly used as a joke gift or as a prop by comedians and other entertainers. Charles was carrying it as a crude form of defense.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: pirate hat

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It appears some careless buccaneer has dropped his headwear here. It is in very good condition and a tag sewn onto the inside simply reads, "ROBERTS".

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: eye patch

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a black eye patch with a skull and cross bones insignia on it.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see what was once an elegant bed with silk sheets. The box spring is broken in the center, the mattress and sheets have been shredded chaotically and there is a big greasy stain where the ogre was sleeping.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see an average bedside table with a single drawer that has a brass keyhole. This an example of a container artifact that can either be opened with the proper key or forced open by using ATTACK or BLAST.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: There was a small postcard inside the drawer. It appears to have suffered greatly during the mailing process, being folded multiple times, splattered with what looks like blood and... is that a lightning bolt burn on one edge?!? **023

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: wood stove

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You see a cast iron wood stove used for both cooking and heat. Too bad it is much too heavy to move or you could get a hefty price for it back at the Main Hall.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: kitchen table

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The kitchen table is old and has suffered much abuse. The legs wobble, a large crack runs through the center and someone has carved "ROCKY THE ROCK WAS HERE" across the top of it.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The cupboards have been carved out of a soft pine and seem much newer than the rest of the kitchen. They are completely bare however and don't look like they have seen much use.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: large table

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The table is made of heavy wood and appears to have suffered much abuse. Stale wads of chewing gum cover the bottom of it, while a mixture of crude sexual drawings and unintelligible scribbling adorn the top.

Simple.name: Name
Simple.value: chalk board

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The chalk board is dusty but otherwise in decent shape. Someone has hastily erased the latest diagrams and scribbling, however, leaving nothing behind for you to read.

Collection.name: FreeUids
Collection.type: System.Collections.Generic.List`1[[System.Int64, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089]], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089
